abstract.text: A set of methods that provide contextual information for transition animations between view controllers.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Don’t adopt this protocol in your own classes, nor should you directly create objects that adopt this protocol. During a transition, the animator objects involved in that transition receive a fully configured context object from UIKit. Custom animator objects — objects that adopt the
protocol — should simply retrieve the information they need from the provided object.

A context object encapsulates information about the views and view controllers involved in the transition. It also contains details about the how to execute the transition. For interactive transitions, the interactive animator object uses the methods of this protocol to report the animation’s progress. When the animation starts, the interactive animator object must save a pointer to the context object. Based on user interactions, the animator object then calls the
methods to report the progress toward completing the animation. Those methods send that information to UIKit so that it can drive the timing of the animations.
When defining custom animator objects, always check the value returned by the
method to determine whether you should create animations at all. And when you do create transition animations, always call the
method from an appropriate completion block to let UIKit know when all of your animations have finished.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The keys you use to identify the view controllers involved in a transition.
The keys you use to identify the views involved in a transition.
A set of methods for implementing the animations for a custom view controller transition.
A set of methods that provide contextual information for transition animations between view controllers.
Notifies the system that user interactions canceled the transition.
Notifies the system that the transition animation is done.
The view that acts as the superview for the views involved in the transition.
Returns the ending frame rectangle for the specified view controller’s view.
Notifies the system that user interactions signaled the completion of the transition.
Returns the starting frame rectangle for the specified view controller’s view.
A Boolean value indicating whether the transition should be animated.
A Boolean value indicating whether the transition is currently interactive.
Tells the system to pause the animations.
Returns the presentation style for the view controller transition.
Returns a transform indicating the amount of rotation being applied during the transition.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the transition was canceled.
Updates the completion percentage of the transition.
Returns the specified view involved in the transition.
Returns a view controller involved in the transition.
A set of methods that enable an object (such as a navigation controller) to drive a view controller transition.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
